page.title: 10FARMING IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: FERTILIZERS. To encourage grass to grow farmers use 34.5 units of nitrogen spread at the rate of 100kg per acre. Grass is an important crop as it is used to make hay and silage to feed the livestock. For Spring barley they use a 20% nitrogen, 10% potash and 10% phosphate fertilizer. They use 150kg per acre. Nitram 5-24-24 is drilled with the Winter barley and the crop is dressed again in April. Winter wheat is treated with 0-29-24 Nitram. The farmer will put 100kg per acre on in October and 150kg per acre in April. Most of the manure used on the fields comes from the cow sheds where it accumulates in Winter and is spread in the Summer when the cows are put out on the grass.
